data.question: What is the chemical formula of SCU-12?
What is the space group of SCU-12?
What is the calculated energy gap for SCU-12?
What is the resistivity of SCU-12 at room temperature?
What is the X-ray detection sensitivity of SCU-12?
What is the lowest detectable X-ray dose rate for SCU-12?
Does SCU-12 maintain structural integrity after 60 kGy Co-60 gamma ray irradiation?
data.answer: No, the X-ray generated photocurrent significantly decreases after 60 kGy gamma ray irradiation.

data.question: Is the SCU-12-based detector sensitive to X-ray photons?
data.answer: Yes, the SCU-12-based detector is highly sensitive to X-ray photons.

data.question: Can SCU-12 be used for direct radiation detection?
Is the energy gap of SCU-12 larger than 2 eV?
Does SCU-12 have a higher X-ray detection sensitivity compared to α-Se?
Is SCU-12 thermally stable up to 300 °C?
data.answer: False, SCU-12 is thermally stable up to 200 °C.

data.question: Does the photocurrent of SCU-12 increase upon X-ray irradiation?
Is the detection limit of SCU-12 less than 1 μGy s−1?
Does SCU-12 exhibit a linear I-V relationship under dark conditions?
data.answer: Yes, SCU-12 shows a linear I-V relationship in the voltage range from −10 to +10 V under dark conditions.

data.question: What is the effect of gamma ray irradiation on the electrical properties of SCU-12?
data.answer: Gamma ray irradiation significantly reduces the X-ray generated photocurrent of SCU-12.

data.question: Can SCU-12-based detectors operate under high electric fields?
data.answer: Yes, SCU-12-based detectors can work in the voltage range from −100 to +100 V, suggesting high field stability.

data.question: Is the operational stability of SCU-12 affected by continuous X-ray irradiation?
data.answer: No, only a 1.5% reduction of photocurrent was observed under continuous X-ray irradiation, demonstrating excellent radiation resistance.

data.question: Does SCU-12 have a higher mass attenuation coefficient compared to traditional Si semiconductor at 60 keV X-ray photon energy?
Is the charge carrier mobility of SCU-12 measured using the time-of-flight technique?
